alert.note: Alert for Acadia; Iberia; Lafayette; Lower St. Martin; St. Landry; St. Mary; Upper St. Martin; Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 4:40PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Iberia, Lafayette, St. Mary, northeastern Acadia, eastern Vermilion, St. Martin and southeastern St. Landry Parishes through 545 PM CST... At 439 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles south of Ramah to near St. Martinville to 13 miles southeast of Intracoastal City. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, New Iberia, Morgan City, Abbeville, Catahoula, Scott, Breaux Bridge, Franklin, Carencro, St. Martinville, Patterson, Jeanerette, Berwick, Church Point, Arnaudville, Belle River, Intracoastal City, Bayou Vista, Avery Island and Burns Point. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 91 and 127. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Acadia; Iberia; Lafayette; Lower St. Martin; St. Landry; St. Mary; Upper St. Martin; Vermilion
